data.title: Buñuel and Mexico The Crisis of National Cinema (Ernesto R. Acevedo-Muñoz, 2003)
data.meta_description: Buñuel and Mexico the Crisis of National Cinema (Ernesto R. Acevedo-Muñoz, 2003) - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. This document provides an introduction to the book "Buñuel and Mexico: The Crisis of National Cinema" by Ernesto R. Acevedo-Muñoz. It discusses how the book analyzes Luis Buñuel's career in Mexico from 1946 to 1965 in historical and industrial context, placing his Mexican films within the framework of Mexican cinema and politics at the time. While some of Buñuel's Mexican films are well-known, they are rarely examined as "Mexican" films. The book aims to understand Buñuel's films in relation to questions of national cinema and the ideology of classical Mexican cinema. It argues Buñuel was able to incorporate surrealist aesthetics into popular Mexican film genres, creating a form
